name: ViaEuropa Competence Centre
goal:
VECC was established in 2012 by senior European experts in European policies, initiatives and regulatory requirements in protecting human health and the environment, energy, internal market, protection of trade secrets, intellectual property rights, research and innovations, as well as in developing and implementing large-scale multi-annual projects funded by the EU.
The Company was established to support and develop activities aimed at providing advice to companies, trade associations, employers association, European Commission, European Parliament and MSs’ governments on management and regulatory issues such as:
• Energy efficiency, internal energy market,
• Regulatory requirements on chemical products, including assessment of the risk to human health and the environment,
• Internal Market organization,
• Development of competence centres for improving skills and knowledge of human resource, developing qualification and training schemes,
• Twinning actions between institutions, organizations and companies from private and public sectors.
The company’s scope of activities includes provision of services in project management, in research and development in the field of natural sciences and technical sciences, delivery of extracurricular educational activities and administrative services. Company experts have extensive experience in managing large, multi-annual European projects aimed at building up partnerships (private, private-public partnerships) for achieving objectives of a common programme, initiative or policy.
interests: Business and Industry, Climate Action, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Research and innovation, Single market
